documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
I still don’t understand a word of Chinese and neither
does any other digital computer because all the computer has is what I have:
a formal program that attaches no meaning, interpretation, or content to any
of the symbols.
What this simple program shows is that no formal program by itself is
sufficient for understanding, because it would always be possible in princi-
ple for an agent to go through the steps in the program and still not have
the relevant understanding. And what works for Chine
